initAll

Initialisation method. Called once.

makeRock

public byte makeRock()
random number god generator Selects a rock and returns it. Currently fair, but the the future it may be biased (on purpose) ...

Returns:
a valid number for index of gemTypes

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
Captures input and calls the processor

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
e - info about button click that happened

processClick

public void processClick(int x,
                         int y)
Click handler Checks if cell is first, or if second is neighbor of first. If not, is a bad value, and lastLocation is forced to -1. If they are neighbors, calls exchange() on them, which does the important part. It is given that there are two pts; this checks for adjacency.

Parameters:
x - x-coordinate of clicked cell
y - y-coordinate of clicked cell

exchange

public void exchange(int x,
                     int y)
Effects the exchange Swaps the cells, then calls the change-effector on each. If finder does not work, this swaps cells back.

Parameters:
x - x-coord of click
y - y-coord of click

kill

public boolean kill(int x,
                    int y)
Kills groups of 3+ This calls the flagger (search(x,y,delX,delY)) on each potential ray to trace. It then shifts the cells down, and makes new rocks as needed.

Parameters:
x - x-coord of start
y - y-coord of start
Returns:
Whether anything was cleared (true) or not (false).

search

public int search(int x,
                  int y,
                  byte master,
                  int delX,
                  int delY)
Finds groups of 3+ This function traces a ray from the point in the direction, stopping early if it runs out of like-typed cells.

Parameters:
x - x-coord of start of single-direction floodfinder
y - y-coord of start of single-direction floodfinder
master - type/color of clicked-on rock; "data[yClick][xClick]&0x0F"
delX - offset direction of X
delY - offset direction of Y
Returns:
A zero if found nothing, a one if something

checkWin

public void checkWin()
Checks to see if win condition has been met This fxn loops over the data, checking for bit 0x10 to be on at each one. If any are off, the user has not won.

updatePictures

public void updatePictures()
Show pictures to user Call me after fixing the data, to update the display.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method

Parameters:
args - The arguments that the OS passes in.
